You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Performance and Security: Help Users Browse Pages and Complete Tasks More Quickly and Confidently

Storefront users can enjoy better performance when browsing pages on your storefront.

Send Order Confirmation Emails Asynchronously
B2B Commerce for Visualforce now loads the Order Confirmation page after a storefront user completes checkout without waiting for the order confirmation email to send successfully. Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce sent order confirmation emails synchronously, which sometimes delayed the loading of the Order Confirmation page. This change improves performance of both the Order Confirmation page and the order confirmation emails.
Scope the Number of Product Spec Values to Query on the Product List Page
Optimize the performance of the Product List page version 2.0 by specifying the maximum number of individual product spec values to query. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides a new configuration setting in the Product List module, Spec Value Query Limit. To fine-tune performance, enter a value that matches the scale and complexity of your product data. The default value is 20000.
Search More Product Data and Show More Results on the Product List Page
Improve the quality and quantity of results B2B Commerce for Visualforce returns when a storefront user searches on your site. B2B Commerce for Visualforce now includes more fields from your product records in CC Product Index records. As a result, the Product List page version 2.0 can now match a search query against each product’s Long Description, SEO Keywords, and Spec Values.
Load Data on the My Account Page More Efficiently
Cart and wishlist data now loads on the My Account page more efficiently. Storefront users can enjoy faster load times and a more responsive account management experience.
Load Data on the Shopping Cart Page Version 1.0 More Efficiently
If you choose to continue using Shopping Cart page version 1.0, your storefront users can enjoy improved performance when loading cart data.
Control How Frequently the Shopping Cart Reprices Items
Gain even more precision over your Shopping Cart page performance by fine-tuning how frequently B2B Commerce for Visualforce calls pricing logic on cart items. No matter which version of the Shopping Cart page you’re using, you can specify how B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares two new fields: the cart’s Repriced Date and the storefront’s Valid Prices Date. A new configuration setting in the Cart module, Optimize Cart Repricing, provides options for how B2B Commerce for Visualforce evaluates these fields. Find the right combination for your storefront, and multiply the improved performance you gain from other Shopping Cart enhancements.
Easily Activate Shopping Carts When Adding Items with the API
When you programmatically add items to an inactive shopping cart using the ccrz.ccApiCart.addTo() method, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now automatically enables the cart's Active Cart field.
Account for Changed Default Guest Permission Set
The default permission set assigned to storefront guest users adds access to the ccrz.ProductList Visualforce page. This change helps ensure a consistent and uninterrupted storefront experience for unauthenticated users.
Set Private Properties on the ccrz.cc_CallContext Object
Salesforce API changed to strictly enforce private properties on objects. As a result, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now requires any subscriber code that directly sets properties on the ccrz.cc_CallContext object to instead use appropriate initialization methods.
Invoke Apex Callouts When Removing a Stored Payment
You can now perform an Apex callout when you extend the default functionality for removing a stored payment on the My Account page. Previously, attempting a callout from an extension to ccrz.cc_hk_Payment.removeStoredPayment() resulted in an exception.

title: Improving Storefront Performance and Security
